intro: Adinandra sylvestris, commonly known as the forest adinandra, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. It produces small, red fruits that are often consumed by birds and other wildlife. Adinandra sylvestris plays a role in local ecosystems as both a food source and a habitat provider.
